description: From em- (variant of en- (prefix with the sense ‘to bring to a certain condition or state’)) +‎ brown (“having a brown colour”, adjective).

verbs.description: embrown (third-person singular simple present embrowns, present participle embrowning, simple past and past participle embrowned) (chiefly literary and poetic, also figuratively)

entries.meaning: To make (something) dark or dusky (“having a rather dark shade of colour”); to brown, to darken.
To become or make brown; to brown.
To become or make dark or dusky; to brown, to darken.
